items.content:
ABOUT US


Disperse is a VC-backed artificial intelligence construction startup focused on improving on-site productivity with the help of computer vision. Our goal is to ultimately re-imagine the way building projects are planned, delivered and operated.


We're currently working on some of the largest building projects in London (e.g. Renzo Piano’s Shard Place, Wood Wharf) and have grown from 5 to 35 people over the past year. We have ambitions to expand significantly, which means that we are looking for passionate and enthusiastic talent to join the team.


We move at a high speed, and will provide you with immense opportunities for initiative, creativity and leadership. Our proudly diverse, international team is based in London, Sarajevo and Yerevan, and has a wealth of experience from construction management to computer vision and robotics.


ROLE DESCRIPTION


We are looking for an experienced Implementation Manager to drive the deployment of our solution with our customers, where the ideal candidate helps implement best practices and new methodologies and successfully drives the overall delivery excellence and customer success for our projects. You will be responsible for driving the delivery across our clients while working closely with cross-functional teams (including technical experts) to deliver defined outputs to time and quality criteria.


As part of this role, you will:



  • Drive the delivery and customer success across our customers

  • Develop customer relationships that promote customer engagement and satisfaction

  • Track and manage delivery output and performance against key KPIs (quality, time)

  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver outcomes in a highly-matrixed environment

  • Ensure that our customers have the best Disperse experience possible, leading implementation sessions, organise training sessions, and drive the fast resolution of issues and inquiries

  • Develop and implement best practices, new methodologies and process steps to drive overall delivery excellence




REQUIREMENTS


You should apply if:



  • You have 3-5+ years of experience from consulting, project management, or related field (bonus points for engineering or manufacturing background)

  • You have strong experience of working with cross-functional teams with a formalized methodology

  • You have strong experience in managing issues, scope and quality

  • You have excellent communication skills with strong customer-orientation

  • You love to get involved in all areas of the business and get hands-on in day-to-day activities

  • You are an avid team player and work to make everyone around you better

  • You are proactive and hands-on, and relish taking on new challenges




BENEFITS



  • Pro rata salary of £52,000 - £60,000 per annum (depending on experience level)

  • Friendly, open and transparent culture.

  • You'll get to join a passionate startup with proven traction on its scaling journey.

  • Flexible working hours / ability to work from home.

  • Regular mentoring and feedback.

  • Awesome startup office in Central London, Fitzrovia.

  • 25 days’ holiday plus all bank holidays.

  • Free coffee.

  • Regular socials, and team retreats to amazing destinations (Tbilisi, Sarajevo... Where next?)

items.title: On Premises Implementation Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Pluralsight

 

On Premises Implementation Engineer

The Opportunity   We are looking for an On-Premise Implementation Engineer responsible for the technical success of our customers and enhancing the GitPrime experience. You will work directly with our customers’ tech leadership to help realize the full potential of GitPrime both in pre-sales and post-sales. You will work with our Senior Implementation Consultants to deliver on the integration and reporting/analytics service pillars of our Professional Services offerings.  Who you are:  * You demonstrate a passion for Pluralsight’s aim and culture; a hands-on worker with integrity and a desire to work in a dynamic environment.  * You are capable of scheduled and unscheduled travel to potential domestic and international customers with a current passport/visa without restrictions to various states or countries.  * You are a customer-focused service engineer with experience working on a distributed team.  * You are a skilled communicator, especially when helping customers through technically challenging processes.  * You possess strong analytical, critical reasoning, and creative problem-solving skills, as well as experience developing and implementing strategic and tactical solutions.  * You are energized by seeing your customers succeed and will go the extra mile to make it happen.  * You are a self-starter who can effectively manage your time, prioritize, produce with autonomy, and provide visibility to key initiatives.  * You have a collaborative and flexible style, with a bias towards action.  * You also have a background in Linux system administration.  * You also have a background in installing and maintaining enterprise-level software. What you’ll own:  * All business and priority escalations for all requests living in the integration & reporting/analytics services pillar.  * Being the voice of the customer in aggregating feedback to deliver to Product Management teams for future roadmap enhancements.  * Driving continuous improvement into our processes and products.  * Guiding both new and existing customers through high-level questions with technical expertise.  * Work closely and collaborate with other technical leaders across the organization.  * Become an expert resource and cultivate a high level of expertise on the Pluralsight libraries, related topics, and associated products.    Experience you’ll need:  * Extensive experience with Replicated is required.  * Experience as a Managed Service Engineer, preferably at a managed cloud computing firm.  * 2+ years using analytics services and tools including BI systems (Tableau, Domo, Qlick) and technology stacks (SQL, Bash, Python).  * Strong experience utilizing and presenting data to both technical and non-technical audiences, especially in the customer-facing arena.  * 2+ years in a SaaS Professional Services or sales environment working directly with service offerings.  * Experience working with SQL database, with Docker, and also have Linux system administration skills.  * Experience and skills around system administration and installing and maintaining enterprise-level software products like JIRA, GitLab, and others. Additional Information Be Yourself. Pluralsight is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

items.content:
Formstack

Implementation Professional Services Consultant

Formstack, transforming the way you collect data and put it to work, is looking for an Implementation & Professional Services Consultant to add to the team. Formstack is a 13-year-old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform. We are seeking people who demonstrate an ability to work effectively with individuals from diverse cultures and backgrounds. Who You Are: You have experience working with customers, solving complex problems, and are driven to keep learning. You are a great communicator, detail oriented, and can see a project through from start to finish. If that's you, you might be just what we need! What You Will Do: Professional Services Consultants (PSCs) are responsible for client engagement during the post-sales process and working with merchants to provide an exceptional onboarding experience. PSCs leverage deep product and industry knowledge to project-manage the onboarding stage of the post-sale process. This is a customer-facing role that involves a combination of remote and onsite merchant interactions. How You Will Succeed:  * Provide an incredible onboarding experience for customers and partners * Accelerate the sales and post-sales (retention & upgrades) cycles by specializing onboarding and training * Develop new efficiencies to shorten onboarding sales stage. * Deliver creative and custom solutions leveraging multiple products and tech stacks. * Be the directly responsible individual (DRI) for moving projects through to completion based on contracted agreements and providing onboarding assistance to applicable accounts.  * Identify unique solutions and approaches to solve complex business and/or technical problems. * Execute against the onboarding process and training curriculum to hold customers accountable to a go-live timeline. * Solve problems on the fly -- be flexible. * Track all customer interaction in Salesforce. What We Are Looking For:  * CSS, HTML, and/or Javascript knowledge * Experience working with a SaaS product * Understanding of RESTful web services * Data management/Data modeling * 1-2 years experience in a customer-facing role, preferably in Consulting, Implementation, Support, Success, or Sales * Ability to work remote or with remote teams * Excellent written and oral English communication skills * Exceptional customer service skills * Excellent attention to detail * Ability to travel for team meetups, conferences, etc. * Excellent time management, written & verbal communication skills. * Proven ability to learn quickly as new products are released. What Formstack Offers: * Free health plans, as well as company-paid Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance Benefits for full-time employees. * Unlimited PTO for all employees * 401k with matching company contribution for full-time employees * The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job * Company-paid conferences and extended learning * Yearly company gatherings Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? CLICK HERE to hear from some current Formstackers about what matters most! Formstack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce. All data collected in our application process from resume collection to application questions is used for recruitment purposes only. We will store it in our applicant tracking system, JazzHR, and will not share this data with anyone else. We will keep your data until the role is filled and only continue to store it if we feel you may fit future roles. Thank you for your interest in Formstack!

items.title: On-Premises Implementation Engineer at Pluralsight
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
On-Premises Implementation Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: System Administrator
Company: Pluralsight | No office location

Technologies

linux
sql

Job description

The Opportunity  

We are looking for an On-Premise Implementation Engineer responsible for the technical success of our customers and enhancing the GitPrime experience. You will work directly with our customers’ tech leadership to help realize the full potential of GitPrime both in pre-sales and post-sales. You will work with our Senior Implementation Consultants to deliver on the integration and reporting/analytics service pillars of our Professional Services offerings. 

Who you are: 

  • You demonstrate a passion for Pluralsight’s aim and culture; a hands-on worker with integrity and a desire to work in a dynamic environment. 

  • You are capable of scheduled and unscheduled travel to potential domestic and international customers with a current passport/visa without restrictions to various states or countries. 

  • You are a customer-focused service engineer with experience working on a distributed team. 

  • You are a skilled communicator, especially when helping customers through technically challenging processes. 

  • You possess strong analytical, critical reasoning, and creative problem-solving skills, as well as experience developing and implementing strategic and tactical solutions. 

  • You are energized by seeing your customers succeed and will go the extra mile to make it happen. 

  • You are a self-starter who can effectively manage your time, prioritize, produce with autonomy, and provide visibility to key initiatives. 

  • You have a collaborative and flexible style, with a bias towards action. 

  • You also have a background in Linux system administration. 

  • You also have a background in installing and maintaining enterprise-level software.

What you’ll own: 

  • All business and priority escalations for all requests living in the integration & reporting/analytics services pillar. 

  • Being the voice of the customer in aggregating feedback to deliver to Product Management teams for future roadmap enhancements. 

  • Driving continuous improvement into our processes and products. 

  • Guiding both new and existing customers through high-level questions with technical expertise. 

  • Work closely and collaborate with other technical leaders across the organization. 

  • Become an expert resource and cultivate a high level of expertise on the Pluralsight libraries, related topics, and associated products.   

Experience you’ll need: 

  • Extensive experience with Replicated is required. 

  • Experience as a Managed Service Engineer, preferably at a managed cloud computing firm. 

  • 2+ years using analytics services and tools including BI systems (Tableau, Domo, Qlick) and technology stacks (SQL, Bash, Python). 

  • Strong experience utilizing and presenting data to both technical and non-technical audiences, especially in the customer-facing arena. 

  • 2+ years in a SaaS Professional Services or sales environment working directly with service offerings. 

  • Experience working with SQL database, with Docker, and also have Linux system administration skills. 

  • Experience and skills around system administration and installing and maintaining enterprise-level software products like JIRA, GitLab, and others.



Additional Information

Be Yourself. Pluralsight is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Apply now

About Pluralsight

About Pluralsight Flow, powered by GitPrime 

GitPrime is now a Pluralsight company, an entire functional department of our new parent company. We are pioneering data-driven engineering. We report on the work patterns and the people-side of software development so engineering leaders can advocate for resources and demonstrate that they're driving business value based on objective data. We have strong product-market fit with hundreds of happy customers and we are growing rapidly.  

Working at Pluralsight 

Founded in 2004 and trusted by Fortune 500 companies, Pluralsight is the technology learning platform organizations and individuals in 150+ countries count on to innovate faster and create progress for the world.  

At Pluralsight, we believe everyone should have the opportunity to create progress through technology. That everyone should have access to the skills of tomorrow. That technology can make the world a better place. Through the work we do everyday, we empower the people who power our world.  

And we don’t let fear, egos or drama distract us from our mission. We’re adults, and we treat each other that way. We have the autonomy to do our jobs, transparency to eliminate office politics and trust each other to do the right thing. We thrive in an environment with creativity around every corner, challenges that keep us on our toes, and peers who inspire us to be the best we can be. We bring different viewpoints, backgrounds and experiences, and united by our mission, we are one.

items.content:
API Integration Specialist

 
We are looking for an API Integration Specialist to support our clients with technical on-boarding/integration as well as continuous technical support.
This is a remote position, must be able to access VPN.

Must have:
· 3+ years experience in a technical support role
· Experience with support tools and ability to build a support process
· Working knowledge with network concepts, firewalls, IIS, API integrations and PostmanAPI (or equivalent)
· Experience and ability to work with clients overseas
· Strong technical troubleshooting skills and problem solving
· Experience in Databases & SQL queries
· Experience in reading log files
· Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills

Plus:
· NServiceBus
· New Relic
· Docker
· Exigence

Any location, work hours approx. 5pm-1am EST

Cross River is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Cross River does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

items.content: A company in San Francisco on the leading edge of data integration and transform is looking for a Data Integration Solutions Consultant to join their Customer Success Team. In this position you will be responsible for providing implementation and consulting services for both new customers, OEM partners, and existing customers. This is a primarily remote position as a full-time employee with excellent benefits. Requirements: o. 5 years experience software solution development/deployment in data integration projects o. Experience in a broad range of database platforms and operation systems, including relational databases (Oracle, DB2, SQL Server), analytical data warehouses (Teradata, Redshift), and other data stores o. Experience with enterprise applications such as SAP, Salesforce, Oracle Application Suite, JD Edwards, Peoplesoft, Siebel o. Experience with ETL technologies Informatica, Snaplogic, Talend, Wherescape is a plus Notes: o. This is a full-time staff primarily remote position o. Some travel maybe required o. Authorized US workers only (the company cannot hold H1 or other visas) o. Questions? Call o. To be considered, email your resume to EN871ProspringStaffing.com with the best number at which to reach you and someone will call you to discuss - provided by Dice

items.title: Integration Consulant (Informatica / Talend) - (Remote Travel role)
items.content: Non-Sponsored candidate for this role. Role: Integration Consultant Location: Remote Travel (50-60% Travel) Fulltime Job Description: As an Integration Consultant you will provide expertise in integrating and configuring supply chain technology solutions to ensure client success. Typical responsibilities include: Meet with clients to brainstorm ideas and understand business requirements Work closely with Solution Architects and Consultants to help design solutions and project plans to meet client needs Configure solution analytics and data model according to the functionality of the customer s source systems (commonly known as MRP/ERP system) or implementing new analytics Map, load and validate client data Resolve complex data and analytic configurations to ensure that the solution is producing the expected results Integrate and customize supply chain solutions to satisfy client-specific processes and business requirements Provide high levels of client service Qualifications Bachelor s degree in engineering, computer science, supply chain management, management information systems, or other relevant technical degree; or equivalent work experience Thorough understanding of the software development life cycle, including business requirements definition, review of functional specifications, development of test plans, testing, user training, and deployment Experience with data modeling, query building and analytics Knowledge of functional supply chain and planning processes, including ERP/MRP, capacity planning, and managing planning activities with contract manufacturers Experience integrating to ERP systems such as SAP and Oracle Experience in systems integration and ETL tools such as Informatica, Talend, SSIS and SSRS strongly preferred Experience with data mapping and systems integration Functional knowledge of supply chain or after sales service operations a plus Experience with supply chain technology solutions such as RapidResponse, 09, Quintiq or similar a plus Exceptional drive, excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, and to immediately contribute in a team environment An ability to manage multiple priorities and perform well in a fast-paced environment, while maintaining a high level of client focus Strong work ethic and high attention to detail, with a desire to learn Thanks & Regards Amir Chaudhary _________________________________________________ Ztek Consulting Inc. Phone: E-mail: Visit us at LinkedIN Profile: _________________________________________________ - provided by Dice

items.title: Systems Integration Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Systems Integration Engineer at Articulate

Remote

ANYWHERE IN US

ENGINEERING

FULL-TIME

The Systems Integration Engineer is a proven technology professional who has experience implementing advanced data and systems integrations between third-party SaaS platforms, in-house systems, and third-party IT systems. This hands-on role will interact with both the product and engineering teams to gather requirements, design solutions, and execute integrations.

What you’ll do:

  • Build and expand our platform by integrating it with key third-party services.
  • Work with the product leadership team to create, prioritize, and manage long-term technology road maps for data and systems integrations.
  • Partner with external companies to understand how to leverage their technology.
  • Learn everything about the technologies and platforms that matter to our largest customers.
  • Be a subject matter expert and point of contact for customers on the implementation and adoption details of our integrations.
  • Provide quality, detailed explanations of third-party integration requirements to the product and support teams.
  • Create prototypes of integrations with various systems. Help transition integrations from prototype to production code.
  • Help lead documentation for integrations and best practices.

What you should have:

  • Integrations experience: You’ve designed and built integrations that allow for greater connections between services.
  • Experience with public APIs, external systems, and services.
  • The ability—and passion—to dive deep into APIs, SDKs of many different platforms, systems, and applications, even when that means experimenting due to poor documentation.
  • Programming experience with multiple languages and technical stacks, including JavaScript and Amazon Web Services.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience communicating technical concepts to nontechnical audiences.

Bonus points:

  • Experience building integrations and apps for platforms such as Slack, Salesforce, CRMs, and HRIS systems.

About Articulate

Articulate is a highly successful, fully remote software company that’s changing the way the world learns. Our award-winning e-learning tools are used by 78,000+ organizations across the globe to create engaging online and mobile courses. Our customers include 93 of the Fortune 100 and 19 of the top 20 U.S. universities. And our online community of 605,000+ members is the largest, fastest-growing community in the industry.

We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We’re all free to exercise our crafts the best way we know how to reach our goals as individuals and teams. Each and every one of us is focused on producing results that directly impact the company’s success. And we all strive to do what’s right by people, both internally and externally, instead of taking the shortest route to the highest profits.

We honor people’s humanity in all of our disparate experiences and social locations, accepting each person as an individual with a story worth listening to and honoring. We believe that honoring everyone’s humanity means being committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an equal opportunity employer and invite applicants to voluntarily disclose their race and gender on our application form to help us create a diverse company. This voluntarily disclosed information will not be shared with any hiring manager and will be kept in confidence by the Articulate human resources department and executives who are not hiring for this position.

Apply for job

items.title: Dell Boomi Integration Developer (Tampa & Remote)
items.content:
United Techno is a Global IT Services firm specializing in niche services including Cloud Integration, Digital Transformation, Modernization and Data intelligence for Retail, Life Sciences and Supply chain customers. United Techno is a premium partner with Dell Boomi executing many integration projects globally.

We are hiring for a SENIOR DELL BOOMI Developer Consultant - Immediate Joining

LOCATION: Tampa, FL and Remote (for the rightly experienced candidates)

Contract Role

Requirements:

Role : Senior Dell Boomi Integration Developer

Role Description: Design, develop, architect Boomi integration processes

Must have Skills: Dell Boomi. / Dell Boomi Certification / Netsuite & Salesforce integration experience, EDI, API Management

- Minimum 2 years of Experience in application integration using Dell Boomi. 8+ years Integration & Architecture experience.
- Proficient in building, deploying and scheduling complex integration processes.
- Experience in building application integrations with solutions like Netsuite, Workday, Salesforce, SFCC, Shopify and others. EDI experience with Boomi will be an advantage.
- Strong presentation and communication skills, should be able to work on multiple integration projects along with a team of integration developers.

Remote Fulltime option is available if you have a strong Boomi experience and able to directly work with clients.

Apply with resume and availability

- provided by Dice

items.title: Epic Integration Developer - Remote
items.content:
We are looking for an Epic Integration Developer for a 1 year long contract opportunity with our client based in Indianapolis, IN. This is a remote opportunity other than the first 1-2 weeks of training onsite.

The Epic Integration Developer will be responsible for the following:

Support team in setting up and troubleshoot Epic/SMART on FHIR integration technical issues
Work on application testing
Participate in all Epic customer-facing meetings including Project Management and Epic TS teams
Work with 3rd party integration partner to maintain and support current document writeback/HL7 integration capabilities

Required Skills:

Possesses a deep understanding of Epic systems and integration points/issues including but not limited to Interconnect, EpicCare Inpatient, Epic Ambulatory, and Data Courier
Highly competent in SMART/FHIR and related issues (e.g., FDI, CORS, SSL, Firewalls)
Experience with SQL & reviewing log files to troubleshoot issues (e.g. analyzing log files if data exchange between application, partner, and customer is not working)

Required Experience:

Bachelor s degree, Computer Science or Engineering preferred
3+ years Software Development experience

Preferred Skills:

Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Interpersonal and communication skills, including managing multiple stakeholders
Desire and able to quickly learn new skills
Knowledge of web communication standards (I.e. REST, JSON) is a plus
Epic TS experience is a plus.

- provided by Dice

items.content:
Integrations Developer at Sability

Remote | Entry-level

Remote, USA

Job Description:
Sability is looking for a software developer to join our systems integrations team. Responsibilities will include designing, coding, testing and troubleshooting integrations between HR, Payroll, Timekeeping, Scheduling, Benefits, General Ledger, Insurance and other related IT systems. You must demonstrate strong general-purpose coding skills, an ability to interpret complex specification documents, and the ability to work effectively from home.
As an Integrations Developer, you will work closely with our HCM implementation consultants to understand the customer’s requirements and create solutions that meet our clients’ business needs. Direct communication with our partners and clients will be required so strong English language written and verbal communication skills are important.

Responsibilities:

  • Deliver high-quality code that integrates IT systems in the most effective way
  • Work with multiple clients, projects and consultants at a time.
  • Work with the HCM consultants, clients and third party software vendors to understand requirements and business needs
  • Create and execute effective test plans to ensure the quality of the solutions delivered
  • Assisting client with solution deployment
  • Manage and resolve issues with delivered integrations

Requirements:

  • A demonstrated ability to create high-quality code in a general-purpose programming language
  • Dell Boomi and Datawatch experience an asset but not required
  • Familiarity with the HCM and/or benefits industries an asset but not required
  • Strong English language written and verbal communication skills
  • Creative problem solving
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Experience working independently without daily supervision
  • Ability to multitask between different projects and clients

Education: Bachelor’s degree or community college education in a coding-related discipline required

Compensation: Base Salary + Annual Bonus dependent upon qualifications and experience

Location: U.S. & Canada, Virtual – No relocation required

Employment: Full-time Salary

Travel: 10% or less

SABILTIY:
Sability is a Human Capital Management strategy and software services Consultancy. We specialize in HCM and WFM System Selection, Design and Implementation of systems such as Kronos, Infor Workbrain, Ceridian Dayforce and Ultimate Software UltiPro. Experienced HCM consultants choose Sability for our flexible work environment and sense of pride and ownership in the success of our clients. We offer virtual fulltime employment opportunities across the US and Canada and are a five-time recipient of SHRM’s “When Work Works” award for workplace flexibility. As a high-growth company, we have also been recognized as a member of the Inc. 5000 and one of Inc. Magazine’s 2017 Best Workplaces.

Apply for job

items.content:
Build Pipeline Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: System Administrator
Industry: DevOps, Internet of Things, Software Development
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Balena | No office location

Technologies

linux
project-management
node.js

Job description

ON BEING A BUILD PIPELINE ENGINEER AT BALENA

We strongly believe that the state of the art in software development, testing, and deployment is light years behind what it could be. Balena engineers take pride on accomplishing more with less by exponentially increasing their productivity through automation and internal tooling, and we are never afraid to question established software development practices, and pioneer our own, to improve the way we work.

As a build pipeline engineer, you will be working on our cross-platform in-house continuous integration system; on internal tools that range from automatic versioning based on commit conventions, to automated project landing website generation; and on discussing and implementing innovative deployment tools and processes within the distributed systems world.

A successful build pipeline engineer is a well-rounded generalist and great communicator that take pride on maximizing the output of their team. They are eager to take responsibility for a project, and are able to make good decisions about the project because they have the context of what's important.

We don't require engineers to already be familiar with the technologies we use. We are happy to invest in people that showcase a strong understanding of the challenges of software development, testing, and deployment along with a willingness to learn and grow.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Actively invest back into our own technology, libraries, and frameworks
  • Be highly motivated to produce great code
  • Maintain the health of our internal build and deployment systems
  • Implement and maintain internal tools to improve our in-house build and deploy pipeline
  • Identify parts of our development and deployment cycle that can be automated, and push to make that happen
  • Challenge orthodoxy when that will help the product evolve
  • Design, architect, and own the execution of your projects
  • Collaborate, brainstorm, and coordinate work with other teammates
  • Understand the high-level goals, and thus know how to prioritize your work

REQUIREMENTS

Need to have:

  • Desire to make yourself and others more effective. You'd be bothered by an inefficient process
  • Good understanding of software engineering practices and how to apply them
  • Excellent written communication skills, and fluency in English
  • Self-discipline to take on a project and push it to completion without too much management. You also know when to ask for help
  • Highly organized, able to handle many threads at once, and keep things moving
  • Strong problem-solving abilities. You know how to split a complex problem into incremental pieces
  • Strong programming and software engineering skills
  • Good understanding of git, Docker, and shell scripting

Nice to have:

  • A sample of your work (URL or attached sample)
  • Contributions to OSS projects (please include a URL)
  • Having worked remotely before
  • Experience with balena as a user
  • Experience with embedded GNU/Linux, anything ranging from personal projects with a Raspberry Pi to commercial or industrial scenarios with custom devices
  • Experience with the GitHub API and GitHub Apps Marketplace
  • Experience with cross-platform application development (macOS, Windows, and GNU/Linux)
  • Experience with Concourse CI and Kubernetes
  • Experience in the Node.js and Rust ecosystem

Make sure to let us know if any of these items apply to you!

BENEFITS

  • Work with an extremely talented, diverse team
  • Equipment of your choice
  • Remote-friendly
  • Flexible working hours
  • Generous vacation policy
  • Annual company gathering in an international location - this year, Barcelona in October
  • We send you hardware for side projects!

ABOUT WORKING AT BALENA

We come from 15+ countries, and we embrace a remote culture with flexible hours. To us, this means being highly productive while still maintaining a healthy work-life balance. You need to be able to work remotely, and have a dependable internet access available so you can join video calls.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We value knowledge and initiative more than educational and personal backgrounds, age, or location. We maintain a work environment in which team members are treated with respect at all times and in which thoughts and ideas can be shared openly.

We communicate proposals, discuss with others in the team and accept feedback if it makes the result better. We value the ability to learn, which is more important to us than knowledge of specific technologies. We know that learning fast means being outside our comfort zone, which is OK -- we'd rather learn than let our assumptions get in our way.

TO APPLY

We're delighted to hear about you! Send us your CV, with a focus on what you can bring to the team. Please include in your cover letter a paragraph about something you worked on that you found technically appealing or exciting.

Apply now

About Balena

Balena provides a software platform that helps developers build, deploy and manage code on connected devices. We brought Docker to embedded GNU/Linux devices in 2013 and have been building our IoT toolkit ever since. We also maintain a variety of successful open source projects including Etcher, openBalena, balenaEngine, and balenaOS, and made contributions to high-exposure projects such as Docker, Electron, and AppImage.

Our technology is open, standards-based, and proven in production across a wide range of scenarios from drones, 3D printers, point-of-sale devices, tidal turbines, skyscrapers and more. Our investors include DFJ, Aspect Ventures, GE, and Ericsson.

Balena is a highly distributed, remote-friendly company with a pretty much flat hierarchy. Our organization is adaptive, getting feedback signals from our users and systems. Right now we organize ourselves by projects, which allow us to build complex features and solve big problems, while staying mutable. As a distributed group, we rely on clear communication and the rule of "assume positive intent" to help us work together across time zones, cultures and first languages. Our base of operations is nominally London, though really we are living all over the world: from Barcelona to Bulgaria, Argentina to Vietnam, and many more.

Benefits

  • Work with extremely talented, distributed team
  • Work remotely
  • Flexible working hours
  • Equipment of your choice
  • Annual company gathering in an international location
  • We send you hardware for side projects!

items.content:
Doximity

Software Engineer, Data (product Integration)

verified
North America
Doximity is transforming the healthcare industry. Our mission is to help doctors be more productive, informed, and connected. As a software engineer focused on our data stack, you'll work within cross-functional delivery teams alongside other engineers, designers, and product managers in building software to help improve healthcare.  Our [team](https://www.doximity.com/about/company#theteam) brings a diverse set of technical and cultural backgrounds and we like to think pragmatically in choosing the tools most appropriate for the job at hand.   **About Us** * We rely heavily on Python, Airflow, Spark, MySQL and Snowflake for most of our data pipelines * We have over 350 private repositories in Github containing our pipelines, our own internal multi-functional tools, and [open-source projects](https://github.com/doximity) * We have worked as a distributed team for a long time; we're currently [about 65% distributed](https://blog.brunomiranda.com/building-a-distributed-engineering-team-85d281b9b1c) * Find out more information on the [Doximity engineering blog](https://engineering.doximity.com/) * Our [company core values](https://work.doximity.com/) * Our [recruiting process](https://engineering.doximity.com/articles/engineering-recruitment-process-doximity) * Our [product development cycle](https://engineering.doximity.com/articles/mofo-driven-product-development) * Our [on-boarding & mentorship process](https://engineering.doximity.com/articles/software-engineering-on-boarding-at-doximity) **Here's How You Will Make an Impact** * Collaborate with product managers, data analysts, and data scientists to develop pipelines and ETL tasks in order to facilitate the extraction of insights from data. * Build, maintain, and scale data pipelines that empower Doximity’s products. * Establish data architecture processes and practices that can be scheduled, automated, replicated and serve as standards for other teams to leverage. * Spearhead, plan, and carry out the implementation of solutions while self-managing. **About you** * You have at least three years of professional experience developing data processing, enrichment, transformation, and integration solutions * You are fluent in Python, an expert in SQL, and can script your way around Linux systems with bash * You are no stranger to data warehousing and designing data models * Bonus: You have experience building data pipelines with Apache Spark in a multi-database ecosystem * You are foremost an engineer, making you passionate for high code quality, automated testing, and other engineering best practices * You have the ability to self-manage, prioritize, and deliver functional solutions * You possess advanced knowledge of Unix, Git, and AWS tooling * You agree that concise and effective written and verbal communication is a must for a successful team * You are able to maintain a minimum of 5 hours overlap with 9:30 to 5:30 PM Pacific time * You can dedicate about 18 days per year for travel to company events **Benefits** Doximity has industry leading benefits. For an updated list, see our career page **More info on Doximity ** We’re thrilled to be named the Fastest Growing Company in the Bay Area, and one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies. Joining Doximity means being part of an incredibly talented and humble team. We work on amazing products that over 70% of US doctors (and over one million healthcare professionals) use to make their busy lives a little easier. We’re driven by the goal of improving inefficiencies in our $3.5 trillion U.S. healthcare system and love creating technology that has a real, meaningful impact on people’s lives. To learn more about our team, culture, and users, check out our careers page, company blog, and engineering blog. We’re growing steadily, and there’s plenty of opportunities for you to make an impact. *Doximity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.* #Location - North America

items.content:
Software Engineer, Data (Product Integration)

Doximity is transforming the healthcare industry. Our mission is to help doctors be more productive, informed, and connected. As a software engineer focused on our data stack, you'll work within cross-functional delivery teams alongside other engineers, designers, and product managers in building software to help improve healthcare. 

Our team brings a diverse set of technical and cultural backgrounds and we like to think pragmatically in choosing the tools most appropriate for the job at hand.  

About Us 
  • We rely heavily on Python, Airflow, Spark, MySQL and Snowflake for most of our data pipelines
  • We have over 350 private repositories in Github containing our pipelines, our own internal multi-functional tools, and open-source projects
  • We have worked as a distributed team for a long time; we're currently about 65% distributed
  • Find out more information on the Doximity engineering blog
  • Our company core values
  • Our recruiting process
  • Our product development cycle
  • Our on-boarding & mentorship process

Here's How You Will Make an Impact 
  • Collaborate with product managers, data analysts, and data scientists to develop pipelines and ETL tasks in order to facilitate the extraction of insights from data.
  • Build, maintain, and scale data pipelines that empower Doximity’s products.
  • Establish data architecture processes and practices that can be scheduled, automated, replicated and serve as standards for other teams to leverage. 
  • Spearhead, plan, and carry out the implementation of solutions while self-managing.

About you 
  • You have at least three years of professional experience developing data processing, enrichment, transformation, and integration solutions
  • You are fluent in Python, an expert in SQL, and can script your way around Linux systems with bash
  • You are no stranger to data warehousing and designing data models
  • Bonus: You have experience building data pipelines with Apache Spark in a multi-database ecosystem
  • You are foremost an engineer, making you passionate for high code quality, automated testing, and other engineering best practices
  • You have the ability to self-manage, prioritize, and deliver functional solutions
  • You possess advanced knowledge of Unix, Git, and AWS tooling
  • You agree that concise and effective written and verbal communication is a must for a successful team
  • You are able to maintain a minimum of 5 hours overlap with 9:30 to 5:30 PM Pacific time
  • You can dedicate about 18 days per year for travel to company events

Benefits 
  • Doximity has industry leading benefits. For an updated list, see our career page

More info on Doximity 
 
We’re thrilled to be named the Fastest Growing Company in the Bay Area, and one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies. Joining Doximity means being part of an incredibly talented and humble team. We work on amazing products that over 70% of US doctors (and over one million healthcare professionals) use to make their busy lives a little easier. We’re driven by the goal of improving inefficiencies in our $3.5 trillion U.S. healthcare system and love creating technology that has a real, meaningful impact on people’s lives. To learn more about our team, culture, and users, check out our careers page, company blog, and engineering blog. We’re growing steadily, and there’s plenty of opportunities for you to make an impact. 


Doximity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

items.title: Senior Tag Implementation Specialist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Senior Tag Implementation Specialist at Hilton

Remote

Hilton Corporate

Job Summary

This position is remote based

Hilton is creating a best-in-class data & analytics department that will lead a connected ecosystem of data, technology, tools, techniques, people and processes. This innovative data & analytics function will drive advanced analytics and actionable insights to help drive Hilton’s performance.

What will I be doing?

The Senior Tag Implementation Specialist will be an integral part of a large corporate Digital Analytics organization where data is at the forefront of its business success. You will be responsible for implementing Adobe’s digital analytics, marketing, and functional pixels via Adobe DTM/Launch for company websites and mobile applications (iOS and Android).

More specifically, you will:

  • Manage the implementation and maintenance of client-side data collection and marketing tools using the company tag management solution (Adobe DTM/Launch)
  • Oversee, build, and maintain JavaScript within Adobe DTM/Launch including QA and UAT activities
  • Execute tag audits using ObservePoint to verify stability and accuracy of client-side data collection and marketing integrations and support organizational governance activities related to tag management
  • Update and/or migrate Tag Management software based on business requirements
  • Maintain robust documentation regarding the tag management architecture
  • Work with the Digital Analytics & Marketing Architecture team to decipher business analytics requirements and deliver implementations which meet those requirements

What are we looking for?

We believe success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills:

  • Collaborative and interpersonal teammates, who build dynamic and positive relationships, exhibit tact and earn trust
  • Strong communicators, both verbally and in writing, who effectively communicate along various business channels and IT partners
  • Flexible and creative in finding solutions for hard problems and work well under pressure
  • Self-starters, who take initiative in leading goals, utilize analytical skills and possess adaptability to change
  • Accountable and focused individuals, who effectively communicate results and recommend improvements
  • Respectful teammates, who possess a good work ethic and high degree of integrity

To fulfill this role successfully, you must possess the following minimum qualifications and experience:

  • Three (3) years of experience implementing analytics via Adobe DTM/Launch for websites/mobile applications (tag implementation / tag migration)
  • JavaScript knowledge
  • Experience implementing tags within single-page app applications
  • Experience testing in multiple web/mobile environments to validate Tag Management Solutions (TMS) accuracy

It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:

  • Five (5) years of experience implementing analytics via Adobe DTM/Launch for websites/mobile applications (tag implementation / tag migration)
  • Experience with ObservePoint
  • Experience with JIRA

What will it be like to work for Hilton?

Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!

EOE/AA/Disabled/Veterans

Apply for job

About TEKsystems:
We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

items.title: Integration Engineer (Remote)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Position Details:Our team is looking to expand and add an Integration Engineer to support upcoming projects. This position is fully remote. You will work from your preferred location, however, your work schedule will be based on Eastern time. This is a contract role at 40 hours per week.
Responsibilities:
Under minimal supervision, you will be working closely with our clients to understand their technical needs. You will then work towards the design, implementation, and testing of client integrations to work with our system. The ideal candidate will also be comfortable being the point of contact for existing integrations, providing services such as technical support, documentation creation, and troubleshooting.
Skills Required:
JavaSpringApache CamelFluent English
Skills Desired:
.NetNode.JsSQL
Experience: 3-5 years as an Integration Engineer or similar role.

items.title: Remote Jenkins Build Engineer - Python, Jenkins
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=16, other=0, dotnet=32, c=0, mobile=0, go=8, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Jenkins, Python, Amazon Web Services, Building / Compiling, debugging services, Linux Administration, Windows Administration, API Design, Writing / Signing Windows MSI packages, Working Remote

This position is 100% REMOTE / Work from home - required experience is Python + Jenkins while AWS, Bamboo + Security is a plus!

We are fast growing, extremely well funded and now established startup in the cloud security and data analysis space. We are backed by huge partners including significant investment by Google Ventures.

We are seeking a talented Build Engineer who is interested in pushing their boundaries and taking on a role that involves significant work in an environment that relies on extremely reliable build / release engineering.

Our team uses technologies that include Python, AWS (lots of services) and Bamboo / Jenkins for CI.

If you are a Software Engineer and you like solving problems, finding and fixing issues, improving application performance and contributing to high transaction, high availability applications and you're interested in a role that's responsible for Blue / Green Release Architecture, Continuous Integration and working with a modern open source stack that includes Python, Bamboo and Jenkins, please read on.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- We are one of the fastest growing startups in america right now (for real)
- Work with modern technologies
- Leverage the performance, power, and scalability of modern cloud computing best practices
- A new product that is revolutionizing cloud data, cloud security and real time cloud processing
- Solve challenging problems for a platform that has incredibly high transactions and an absurd amount of data / big data and big data processing

What You Will Be Doing

- Working as part of a build team that will be working to build / release code written in Python and GoLang
- Working w/ Bamboo and Jenkins
- Participating in Blue / Green Architecture / Deployment / automated build / release and deployment engineering
- Work on complex Builds that communicated w/ AWS and are highly scalable

What You Need for this Position

Experience w/ the following:

- Python + Jenkins expertise is a MUST

The following are all nice to haves:
- Bamboo
- Strong knowledge of Continuous Integration
- AWS
- Windows MSI Packages
- Linux & Windows Administration

What's In It for You

Super cool company culture - very well funded startup, proven industry executives, great company culture, bleeding edge technology stack
Work on extremely challenging and thought provoking problems
Great base salary + equity + bonus + PTO and great other benefits too!So, If you are a Build Engineer and you like solving problems, finding and fixing issues, improving application performance and contributing to high transaction, high availability applications and you're interested in a role that's responsible for Build Engineering w/ a modern open source stack that includes Python, Bamboo and Jenkins, please apply!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
